pros: Small enough to learn, but just big enough to have a full days worth of work.
cons: Services several cities across several county lines.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Pearland, TX
pros: Close to home, good people, management, peers, team work
cons: Low pay, short staff, management, staff, time

review_title: ER nurse at HCA Houston Healthcare Kingwood
job_title: Registered Nurse, Emergency Room in Houston, TX
pros: Overtime available, career progression is easy to pursue. Free RN-BSN through Galen College of Nursing
cons: High turnover rate, Management is very disorganized. HR took 6+ months to pay my sign on bonus.

pros: wonderful people to work with
cons: pay is definitely way under market value

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Kingwood, TX
pros: They are lenient. If something horrible happens, most likely you'll still keep your job
cons: High patient ratio, at times up to 7 or 8 lately. Upper management doesn't care about patient safety and any complaints will fall on deaf ears.

pros: Plenty of overtime, but management will complain about ‘productivity numbers’=profit margins
cons: Patient to nurse ratios are dangerously unsafe, if you value your nursing license RUN! Management will bully you if you try to address safety issues with them, same with TX BON safe harbor forms, be prepared for retaliation and blame shifting. Do not expect fair compensation, most nurses have left, as HCA pays the lowest in the industry and has failed to keep up with the current market value for RN’s. Kingwood is basically a training grounds for better hospitals like MH. HCA Kingwood spent money to put a player grand piano in their lobby - instead of focusing on their patient’s safety and limited nursing staff.

review_title: No different than most HCA facilities
pros: At least you will be employed.
cons: It seemed to be very unorganized, and kind of all over the place. Patient assignments are not based on acuity, but what room is close to the other one. A lot of new grads are in charge.

review_title: Good learning experience, bad continued working experience
pros: Good benefits, plenty of overtime for those who need it, lots of learning experiences
cons: Management that throws you to the wolves, promises made and broken consistently, floating is not done equally (if you are new, you float any time the older nurses complain about floating), patient assignments are based on your popularity rather than evening out the load based on acuity, you have to sign a contract for 2 years if you go into their residency program and if you break that you pay $10,000 (they say you pay off based on how short you cut your 2 year contract but a friend worked for 1 year and 10 months and he still was forced to pay $5,000 back)

pros: Once was a great place.
cons:
No staff, no accountability.
Administration isn’t helpful.
Directors promote poor attitude and zero accountability.
Minimal standards of nursing care doesn’t exist.

pros: Benefits and tuition and pto
cons: Bad management, harassing staff, too much work for one person

pros: coworkers are friendly, Mostly. at least night shift is.
cons: unsafe assignments, unsafe patient ratios, poor pay, disrespect from higher ups

pros: Able to make your own schedule
cons: So focused on the business aspect of the hospital, patient care and clinical staff are compromised."

review_title: i love my job because i care about the patient care
job_title: Patient Care Assistant (PCA) in Houston, TX
pros: environment is awesome working here i learn a lot
cons: i will love to learn more

pros: Available growth and close to home.
cons: I would rather not speak ill about the company

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Houston, TX
pros: Great team work at the time
cons: Short staffed, micro managed to meet numbers

pros: easy work aquatatainces, very hard working people
cons: no good food, mean patients

job_title: Lab Processing Technician in Kingwood, TX
pros: Fast paced, never sitting still.
cons: Do not get paid enough for how much work you will be doing.

pros: Monday through Friday no weekend
cons: Heavy work load with no overtime

review_title: Horrible!!!! Don't waste your time or talent. This place sucks the life out of you!!!
pros: Nothing!!! Orientation stinks-it's sink or swim, management do not care. The only director that actually cared was fired for trying to make a difference.
cons: This is an HCA facility-for profit hospital. That means they cut staffing so much that Registered Nurses have to perform the job function of 5 different people while only being paid to do one. As a Registered Nurse,  you have to provide nursing-that's a given. I was not hired to be a CNA/Tech, Telemetry tech, Unit Secretary and Food Service worker. I interviewed for an Observation nurse position. When I started working, I was required to take surgical, medical and telemetry patients. No job is above me but I did not get my Bachelors degree in nursing to wipe butts, give bed baths, remove patient trays from their rooms, or do order entry in the middle of trying to care for my patients. The nurses are stretched so thin that there is no way you can perform safe nursing practice while being expected to answer the stupid phone that you are required to carry while attempting to pull medication, perform an assessment or even educate the patient. There are so many distractions!!! Steer clear of this place if you are worried about losing your nursing license.

pros: Good for experience purposes if you cannot get in to one of the far superior major not for profit systems in the surrounding Houston area. The ability to build longstanding relationships with the great frontline caregivers that you work with. Flexibility in scheduling, at least within the department that I worked.
cons: The frontline staff is underpaid, under-appreciated, and overworked. The patient load is ridiculous. However, most caregivers are green, have never worked anywhere else, and have no idea what a great organization looks like. Upper management is a joke, and no matter how much you talk they will never listen. It's very difficult to maintain a positive attitude in a hospital that is so dysfunctional. Also, the interdepartmental communication is seriously lacking.

pros: Salary, commute time!some (few) nice folks
cons: HORRIBLE clinical care for the most part. Providers who do NOT see the patient and write notes as if they did. NO AUTHENTIC NURSING LEADERSHIP, conflict of interest/fraud behavior. AND MOST OF ALL...THE ORGANIZATION DOES NOT CARE. they display no ethics. They do not care about employees, either as workers or humans. The staffing is dangerous and patients are constantly moved from floor to floor because there are not enough nurses...because the competent,smart ones quickly leave.....

review_title: The doctors and nurses that work there are fantastic; however, the management is less than average.
pros: The staff members are nice. The benefits are good. There are a great deal of opportunities for advancement. There are added perks to working their like discounts on food, and holiday celebrations.
cons: The supervisors do not have very much respect for their employees. They do not acknowledge when an employee is doing a good job.

review_title: Do not waste your time here.
pros: Some of the staff is amazing and I don’t know how they’ve managed to hold on to them. Although I will say their turn over rate for middle management and staff speaks volumes about the senior management.
cons: Low pay, high cost benefits and high deductibles, unrealistic expectations for patient loads, dangerous assignments that you are not properly trained to take but threatened with losing your job if you don’t, unappreciative senior management.. the list goes on.

pros: They have decent pay. Most of the people you work with are nice.
cons: The management is about the dollar. The imaging department isn’t overly concerned with doing the right thing or keeping their employees happy. Not at all cooperative or understanding with pregnant employees if you are technically considered “PRN” even if you work a full time hours. You will work your tail off! They are generally understaffed and frequently ask you to flex so you don’t always get your full hours.

pros: This is my first job after graduating. What i like best about this place is how busy it is. It has given me great oppurtunity to increase and improve my skills.
cons: There are some eployees that i would not allow to put a hand on me. I feel as if i have to pick up slack for some of those i work with, and i feel leadership is oblivious to this. Management does not reward good work

pros: Depending on the night there was good teamwork. Most of the CNA's rocked so my ppl that were dependent on briefs were dry and I had no problem helping with the heavier ppl because that is I started and I am not above doing that for my ppl.
cons: Constantly worked over 12 hours due to charting. No time to eat because of new admissions, passing medications, and doing wound care changes.

review_title: Kingwood Medical Center is the place to work!
pros: Small but rapidly growing hospital with a culture of excellence in patient care, highly trained staff, open and respectful communication between physicians and nurses. Plenty of opportunity for personal growth both academically through a partnership with UT Arlington and in your chosen career path. Supportive management team.
cons: Growing pains and construction but the outcome will allow us to provide better services

job_title: Patient Care Assistant in Humble, TX
pros:
-They worked with your school schedule. 
-They pay slightly higher than neighboring hospitals at the time
-The nurses in the Med-Surgical Unit were nice at the time
cons: Not all the departments are the same. Your experience will depend on whether the department manager is good or not unfortunately.

review_title: Nursing at an HCA facility in Kingwood TX
pros: Complex patients, good experience for new nurses, not Magnet and will hire nurses with ADN degrees, not required to have a BSN, lots of overtime is available
cons: Pay is less than other facilities in Houston, frequent changes in managers, CEO does not listen to nurses concerns even though she is a nurse, ICU nurses triple up and take care of 3 patients especially at night, heavy dependence on agency for staffing.  It is a for profit company more concerned about the bottom line than anything else.

review_title: A review from a current employee
pros: I really like the people I work with.  I schedule myself and my employer trys to give me the days off I want.
cons: Very low pay, always work short handed, more work than a single person can possibly do in one day

job_title: RN Case Management in Kingwood, TX
pros: Nice new facility and a good location if you live in Kingwood/Humble area. Most of the staff are really nice.
cons: Not the best salary; NO work/life balance and management was not empathetic if family issues came about. The social workers are lazy and the RN Case Managers do all of the work.

review_title: Horrible management in the pediatric ER, dangerous patient environment.
pros: Fellow nurses were great. There is a good discount at the hospital cafeteria. There is free parking for employees. That's about all the pros
cons: Real chance of losing your RN license. HCA is all about money, not patient care. The use an ancient version of Meditech that hinders patient care and proper documentation. Crucial medication is not readily available and can take over an hour to acquire from pharmacy.

pros: The workload is too much and dangerous. They pay way below the market value. The department is very disorganized. They do hire a lot of new grads but eventually they quit and move on to better respectable hospitals. The turnover is high.
cons: The benefits were good. There is always most of the time overtime due to people quitting.

job_title: Certified Nurse Assistant/Medical ­ Surgical in Houston, TX
pros: Great place to learn while you are attending nursing school.
cons: Better support from management, Everyone should would together as a team. No one is better than the next
